project1.description: This web app was an attempt to simplify the presentation of the city of Nashville's official COVID-19 reopening plan by using cards and filter buttons for each phase of the plan to dynamically reprint the DOM.
project1.technologiesUsed: HTML, CSS, Vanilla JavaScript, Version Control with Github
project1.title: COVID-19 Mayor Challenge

project2.description: A HG2G-themed chatroom simulation app built as a group project assignment during my enrollment at Nashville Software School while we were learning to use modules and webpack.
project2.technologiesUsed: HTML, CSS, Vanilla JavaScript, Version Control with Github
project2.title: Hitchhiker's Guide Chat App

project3.description: A fictitious e-commerce site for a company that sells sweatpants built as a group project assignment during my enrollment at Nashville Software School while we were learning to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and Bootstrap.
project3.technologiesUsed: HTML, CSS, Vanilla JavaScript, Version Control with Github
project3.title: Sweaty's Sweatpants Store

project4.description: A simulation of restaurant magement software with authentication-requiring features that utilizes the CRUD method (Create, Read, Update, & Delete) with the Google Firebase API. Also built as a group project assignment during my enrollment at Nashville Software School.
project4.technologiesUsed: HTML, CSS, Vanilla JavaScript, Firebase, Axios, Version Control with Github
project4.title: La Baguette Restaurant Manager

project5.description: A single-page web app built with HTML, BOOTSTRAP, SASS, and JS that allows users who authenticate their account via Google sign-in to post images as 'pins' which are organized into 'boards'. This was built as an assignment during my enrollment at Nashville Software School while we were learning to use Firebase, Axios, and CRUD.
project5.technologiesUsed: HTML, CSS, Vanilla JavaScript, Firebase, Axios, Version Control with Github
project5.title: PIИTEЯST

project6.description: A simulated theme park management app that lets the user manage staff members, schedules, attractions and more. Supports Google login. This was built as group project during my enrollment at Nashville Software School while we were learning to use Firebase, Axios, and CRUD.
project6.technologiesUsed: HTML, CSS, Vanilla JavaScript, Firebase, Axios, Version Control with Github
project6.title: Jurrasic World

project7.description: A single-page web application I created for users to be able to discover and support Black-owned restaurants in the Nashville area. I built this using React and REST API's from Yelp, MapQuest and Firebase as my front-end capstone project while enrolled at Nashville Software School.
project7.technologiesUsed: React, JavaScript, HTML, CSS, Firebase, Axios, Version Control with Github
project7.title: Black Food Nashville

project8.description: A full-stack 'spoiler-preventing' chat room app I created using React, Python and Django where users can host viewing party type events to discuss live TV shows in real time. The app calculates time differences in each user's stream to delay the display of new messages on their chat feeds to prevent spoilers.
project8.technologiesUsed: React, JavaScript, Python, Django, HTML, CSS, Firebase, Version Control with Github
project8.title: ChatSync
